structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS
COUNTY GOVERNMENT (FISCAL COURTS AND COUNTY COMMISSIONERS)

law.catch_line: Use of county ordinance and resolution -- Form -- Amendment.

text.section: No action embraced in the term "county ordinance" may be taken except by passage of a county ordinance. Other official actions, including but not limited to approvals required by the fiscal court, may be taken by resolution, order, or motion;
All ordinances shall be introduced in writing;

No county ordinance shall relate to more than one (1) subject, and each ordinance shall be prefaced in the following manner by a title which expresses that subject: "AN ORDINANCE relating to (the subject of the ordinance):";

There shall be inserted between the title and the body of each county ordinance an enacting clause written in the following manner: "Be it ordained by the fiscal court of county of.........., Commonwealth of Kentucky:";
County ordinances shall be amended by ordinance and only by setting out in full each amended section;

No action of a fiscal court shall be invalidated because of improper denomination of a county ordinance or other written document, if the procedures required for taking the action have otherwise been observed.

law.history: Created 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 118, sec. 4, effective June 17, 1978.
